title: 20 Food Recommendations Using Food Chaining Method
description: A detailed set of food recommendations structured for a patient with avoidant/restrictive food intake disorder, tailored specifically to their liking for chicken while avoiding beef and sesame.

foods.goal: Increase familiarity with different cooking methods.
foods.transition_strategy: Start by having grilled chicken in a familiar seasoning then gradually try different marinades.
foods.food_precautions: Ensure no sesame or beef-based ingredients are used in marinades.

foods.goal: Provide a crunchy texture option.
foods.transition_strategy: Prepare tenders lightly breaded, using familiar breadcrumbs, then introduce new spices gradually.
foods.food_precautions: Check the breadcrumb ingredients for sesame oil or seasoning.

foods.goal: Introduce vegetables gradually.
foods.transition_strategy: Incorporate just a little finely chopped celery or carrots into the chicken salad first.
foods.food_precautions: Use mayonnaise or yogurt dressing; verify no allergens present.

foods.goal: Try different flavor profiles of chicken.
foods.transition_strategy: Buy from a trusted source or make at home; gradually try different herbs without allergens.
foods.food_precautions: Avoid any products that might have sesame-based seasonings.

foods.goal: Encourage exploring liquids/textures.
foods.transition_strategy: Start with a familiar broth, adding in chicken pieces and mild spices slowly.
foods.food_precautions: Ensure broth is homemade or checked for allergens.

foods.goal: Introduce a familiar comfort food with chicken.
foods.transition_strategy: Use a simple cheese and soft tortilla; gradually try varied fillings.
foods.food_precautions: Ensure cheese and tortillas are free of sesame ingredients.

foods.goal: Introduce a variety of textures with chicken.
foods.transition_strategy: Begin with chicken and one type of mild vegetable; increase variety over time.
foods.food_precautions: Use soy sauce safe for allergies, ensuring no sesame oil.

foods.goal: Introduce a new base for meals.
foods.transition_strategy: Begin with plain white rice; later introduce varied herbs/spices.
foods.food_precautions: Ensure no sesame oil is used.

foods.goal: Expand carbohydrate options gradually.
foods.transition_strategy: Start with plain pasta and a light olive oil drizzle, then add chicken and mild vegetables.
foods.food_precautions: Confirm no cross-contamination with sesame products.

foods.goal: Introduce a healthier grain alternative.
foods.transition_strategy: Cook quinoa simply with water; can mix with cooked chicken for flavor.
foods.food_precautions: Rinse well to remove saponins that may cause distaste.

foods.goal: Explore sandwich options with familiar ingredients.
foods.transition_strategy: Start with plain bread to make sandwiches with chicken; try a variety of spreads.
foods.food_precautions: Verify no sesame seeds on bread or in spreads.

foods.goal: Introduce a light and fluffy grain.
foods.transition_strategy: Prepare simply with water, then mix with chicken and herbs.
foods.food_precautions: Ensure no sesame oil or seeds in the preparation process.

foods.goal: Introduce green veggies slowly.
foods.transition_strategy: Start with a small portion, well-cooked; integrate with chicken in stir-frys.
foods.food_precautions: Ensure no sesame-based sauces are used.

foods.goal: Familiar comfort food with added nutrition.
foods.transition_strategy: Starting simply with butter; later add finely minced cooked veggies.
foods.food_precautions: Check for allergenic ingredients in pre-made products.

foods.goal: Introduce raw vegetables for crunch.
foods.transition_strategy: Serve alongside a favorite dip to enhance acceptance, avoiding sesame dips.
foods.food_precautions: Cut into manageable sizes for easier eating.

foods.goal: Try a low-carb vegetable alternative.
foods.transition_strategy: Start with simple noodles with olive oil; introduce chicken slowly.
foods.food_precautions: Check cooking oils and sauces used.

foods.goal: Introduce soft fruits for easy texture.
foods.transition_strategy: Start with slices; oversee how the patient reacts, then gradually blend into smoothies.
foods.food_precautions: Ensure no cross-contact with allergens.

foods.goal: Introduce fruits in a familiar form.
foods.transition_strategy: Start with plain applesauce, and monitor for allergies before testing chunks of apple.
foods.food_precautions: Check label for any added preservatives that might contain allergens.

foods.goal: Introduce color and variety.
foods.transition_strategy: Start with very small portions, checking for any adverse reactions.
foods.food_precautions: Opt for organic if possible to avoid pesticide residues.

foods.goal: Introduce more fruit variety.
foods.transition_strategy: Start with small slices; gradually combine with yogurt based dips.
foods.food_precautions: Ensure no cross-contact with allergens.

notes.content: The patient can gradually incorporate these foods into their diet over the next 4-6 weeks. Start with the first week focusing on one new food item at a time and see how comfortable the patient feels. Increase variety slowly every week.

Always check labels and ensure cross-contamination does not occur with sesame during preparation. If any allergic reactions occur when introducing new foods, revisit the earlier strategies and consult a dietitian for further assistance.
